title: Education
text:
I earned my Ph.D. in Biostatistics from The Ohio State University in 2023. My research focuses on multistate transition models and causal inference, with a strong emphasis on healthcare applications.


Education

PhD in Biostatistics, The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH, USA 2023
MS in Biostatistics, Tulane University, New Orleans, LA, USA 2017
BS in Pharmaceutical Formulation， China Pharmaceutical University, Nanjing, China, 2015



Publication

Zhu Y, Brock G, Li L. Uniformization and bounded Taylor series in Newton–Raphson method improves computational performance for a multistate transition model estimation and inference. Statistical Methods in Medical Research. 2024;0(0). doi:10.1177/09622802241283882
Donneyong, M. M., Zhu, Y., Zhang, P., Li, Y., Hunold, K. M., Chiang, C., ... & Li, L. (2023). A comprehensive assessment of statin discontinuation among patients who concurrently initiate statins and CYP3A4‐inhibitor drugs; a multistate transition model. British Journal of Clinical Pharmacology, 89(7), 2076-2087.
Zhu, Y., Chiang, C. W., Wang, L., Brock, G., Milks, M. W., Cao, W., ... & Li, L. (2021). A multistate transition model for statin‐induced myopathy and statin discontinuation. CPT: Pharmacometrics & Systems Pharmacology, 10(10), 1236-1244.

title: Post With Code
text:
This is a post with executable code.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: KM plot based on R package survminer
text:
This blog offers a comprehensive guide on using the ggsurvplot() function from the survminer package, with a focus on utilizing various arguments to customize and enhance the survival plots.”

library("survminer")
require("survival")
fit <- survfit(Surv(time, status) ~ sex, data = lung)


ggsurvplot(
  fit,                     # survfit object
  data = lung,  # data
  palette = c("black", "black"), # color for each group
  linetype =c(4,1), # linetype for each group
  risk.table = TRUE,       # show risk table.
  pval = TRUE,             # show p-value of log-rank test.
  pval.coord= c(800, 0.85), # p value location
  #conf.int = TRUE,         # show confidence intervals 
  xlim = c(0,1000),        # limit for X axis
  # survival estimates.
  break.time.by =100 ,     # break X axis in time intervals by 500.
  xlab="Time",
  ylab="Survival probability",
  legend.title = "",
  legend.labs = c("Female", "Male"), #legend label
  #ggtheme = theme_minimal(), # customize plot and risk table with a theme.
  risk.table.y.text.col = T, # colour risk table text annotations.
  risk.table.y.text = TRUE, # show bars instead of names in text annotations
  risk.table.title= "Number"
  # in legend of risk table
)
